meanings.definition: Act dishonestly or unfairly in order to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent1: He cheated by peeking at the answers during the test.
meanings.sent2: She cheated in the game by moving her piece when no one was looking.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon cheated the other animals out of their snacks.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox cheated its way into the henhouse.
meanings.sent5: The crafty magician cheated the audience with his clever tricks.

meanings.sent1: The con artist cheated the old man out of his savings.
meanings.sent2: He cheated his friend by pretending to be someone else online.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat cheated the dog into giving up its toy.
meanings.sent4: The shadows in the forest cheated the travelers into taking the wrong path.
meanings.sent5: The mirage in the desert cheated the explorers with its illusion of water.

meanings.definition: Be unfaithful to a partner in a romantic relationship.
meanings.sent1: She cheated on her boyfriend by going out with someone else.
meanings.sent2: He cheated on his girlfriend by texting another girl behind her back.
meanings.sent3: The soap opera character cheated on her husband with his twin brother.
meanings.sent4: The forbidden love cheated the two lovers out of a happy ending.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal of trust cheated the relationship of its foundation.
